Introduction of cardiac pacemaker system via vein

text.paragraph: Patient has no history of implantable devices

section.title: RESULTS
section.text: Laboratory Test: None needed. Laboratory Values/Results: No Lab Result data

section.title: ASSESSMENTS
section.text: The patient was found to have Anemia and Dr Seven and his staff diagnosed the condition and treated Ms Clarkson for Anemia during the 2 day stay at Community Health Hospitals. Ms Clarkson recovered from Anemia during the stay and is being discharged in a stable condition. If there is fever greater than 101.5 F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness the patient is advised to contact emergency.

tr.td: Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week for Follow up with Outpatient facility.

observation.text: Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week for Follow up with Outpatient facility.

tr.td: b. Negotiated Goal to keep Body Temperature at 98-99 degrees Fahrenheit with regular monitoring (Visual Inspection)
Need to gain more energy to do regular activities (Visual Inspection)

list.item: Appointments: Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week. Follow up with Outpatient facility.
Medications: Take prescribed medications as advised.
d. For Fever of > 101.5 F, or onset of chest pain/breathlessness contact Emergency

tr.td: Dr Henry Seven has successfully discharged Ms Jane Clarkson and has advised her to follow the diet recommendations. The patient was found to have Anemia and Dr Seven and his staff diagnosed the condition and treated Ms Clarkson for Anemia during the 2 day stay at Community Health Hospitals. Ms Clarkson recovered from Anemia during the stay and is being discharged in a stable condition. If there is fever greater than 101.5 F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness the patient is advised to contact emergency.
Dr Henry Seven after treating Ms Jane Clarkson has seen considerable progress in her health in the two days that she was admitted to the hospital.
